    • Constructor Detail

      • WorldStatusHandler

        public WorldStatusHandler()

    • Method Detail

      • updateWorldTime

        public void updateWorldTime​(long worldAge,
                            long timeOfDay)
        Updates the world time will calculate the time of day by taking the world age modulo 24000. World age is in seconds, time of day in ticks
        Parameters:
        worldAge - Age of the world in seconds
        timeOfDay - Time of the day in ticks, usually on a scale from 0 to 23999

      • updateOnGameJoin

        public void updateOnGameJoin​(int dimension,
                             byte difficulty,
                             byte maxPlayers,
                             java.lang.String lvlType,
                             boolean debugInfo)
        Right after joining a server it will once provide all of this information to us
        Parameters:
        dimension - -1 = nether, 0 = overworld, 1 = end
        difficulty - 0 = peaceful, 1 = easy, 2 = normal, 3 = hard
        maxPlayers - Player amount once used for drawing tab lists, not actually used for anything in a Notchian client
        lvlType - generation type, examples include: default, flat, largeBiomes, amplified, default_1_1
        debugInfo - If true, a Notchian client shows reduced information on the debug screen

      • updateOnRespawn

        public void updateOnRespawn​(int dimension,
                            byte difficulty,
                            java.lang.String lvlType)
        Sent by the server when the player is sent to a new world/respawning
        Parameters:
        dimension - -1 = nether, 0 = overworld, 1 = end
        difficulty - difficulty
        lvlType - generation type, examples include: default, flat, largeBiomes, amplified, default_1_1

      • getTimeOfDay

        public long getTimeOfDay()
        Time of day is measured in ticks on a scale from 0 to 23999
        Returns:
        Time of day in ticks

      • getWorldAge

        public long getWorldAge()
        World age is measured in seconds, servers increment it by one every 20 ticks
        Returns:
        World age in seconds

      • getDimension

        public int getDimension()
        -1 = nether, 0 = overworld, 1 = end in vanilla. May be anything else on custom servers
        Returns:
        Dimension id of the world the player is in

      • getDifficulty

        public byte getDifficulty()
        0 = peaceful, 1 = easy, 2 = normal, 3 = hard
        Returns:
        Current difficulty of the server

      • getLevelType

        public java.lang.String getLevelType()
        generation type of the world, examples include: default, flat, largeBiomes, amplified, default_1_1
        Returns:
        Descriptor of the generation type of the world

      • getMaxPlayers

        public byte getMaxPlayers()
        Was once used by Notchian clients to draw the player list, but now is ignored
        Returns:
        Legacy number for properly drawing tab lists

      • showDebugInfo

        public boolean showDebugInfo()
        If true, a Notchian client shows reduced information on the debug screen.
        Returns:
        Does the server want players to see additional F3 debug info
